newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Asia Fuel Oil - Quiet, awaiting fresh directions.
newsitem.headline: Asia Fuel Oil - Quiet, awaiting fresh directions.

text.p: The high sulphur fuel oil market was quiet on Thursday in thin talks with many traders sitting back awaiting for a clearer market direction.
A lack of physical activities and movements in the swaps market dampened sentiment and discouraged trading, traders said.
The 180-cst grade was offered at $101 per tonne, compared with Wednesday's offers at $98/$99 per tonne, but there was no buyer, traders said.
In the swaps market, fuel oil hovered around Wednesday's levels, with March last quoted at $98.50/$99.50 per tonne and April at $97.00/$98.00.
Singapore weekly residue stocks soared by a hefty 2.097 million barrels in the week ending March 12 to 12.692 million barrels, Trade Development Board (TDB) said on Thursday.
The bearish data is the highest volume seen since early May 1996 when it hit 12.909 million barrels.
"The high TDB residues data has been expected. It's not surprising," said one trader.
"The data won't have a major impact on the market but it will take quite a while to digest the stocks," he said, seeing a slight downtrend for cargo prices.
Despite several current maintenance turnarounds in Singapore, Thailand and more in South Korea and Japan in coming months, traders said they did not see fresh enquiries.
However, some traders were not pessimistic.
"Demand should gradually pick up when the whole China enters the harvesting season (in April)," said one trader. He added that not many cargoes are coming in this direction.
This trader, noting the $1.5 spread between March/April swaps, said: "I think demand is quite all right at the moment."
However, most traders admitted that prices in this region remained stronger than those in other regions.
The LSWR market remained quiet and traders considered current prices here are too high compared to alternative burning crude like Duri.
(Prices in dollars per tonne, unless stated)
MTH FOB SIN BUY/SELL PREV BUY/SELL
APR FUEL OIL SWAPS 97.00/98.00 96.50/97.50
*Dollars per barrel
--Singapore newsroom (+65-870 3571)
